text: Minehead is a seaside town and civil parish in Somerset, England. It is in the borough of Somerset West and Taunton. In 2011, the town had a population of 11,981. It is close to the border with Devon. The town is 21 miles (34 km) north-west of Taunton, Somerset's county town. It is close to the Exmoor National Park. Minehead is famous for being the location of Butlin's Minehead, a popular holiday camp owned by Butlin's. The town is the starting point of the South West Coast Path, the longest countryside walking trail in the United Kingdom. ==Twinning== Minehead has one twin town. It is twinned with: * Saint- Berthevin, France ==Gallery== File:View_Over_Minehead_From_Hill.jpg|Minehead from the west File:Skyline_Pavilion,_Minehead,_Somerset.jpg|Butlin's Minehead File:Looking_across_Minehead_Strand_-_geograph.org.uk_-_398551.jpg|Minehead beach Category:Towns in Somerset Category:Civil parishes in Somerset
title: Minehead
